intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. lonchodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This subspecies is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
